criteria: Understanding of Supply and Demand Principles
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of supply and demand principles.
Student shows a minimal understanding of supply and demand, with significant misconceptions.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of supply and demand but struggles to apply it to real-world examples.
Student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of supply and demand and can apply it to some examples.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of supply and demand and can apply it to various examples with accuracy.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of supply and demand, can apply it accurately to complex scenarios, and can explain its impact on wage differences.
Student does not mention or demonstrate any understanding of productivity.
Student vaguely mentions productivity but shows no understanding of its relevance to wage differences.
Student demonstrates a limited understanding of productivity and its connection to wages.
Student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of productivity and its relationship to wages, providing simple examples.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of productivity and clearly explains its impact on wage differences with relevant examples.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of productivity, provides insightful analysis of its influence on wages, and considers various factors affecting productivity.
Student fails to explain any wage differences among jobs and professions.
Student offers a very limited and inaccurate explanation of wage differences.
Student provides a basic explanation of wage differences but lacks depth and accuracy.
Student adequately explains some wage differences using supply and demand and productivity, but some explanations are unclear or incomplete.
Student clearly and accurately explains wage differences among various jobs and professions using supply and demand and productivity.
Student provides a thorough and insightful explanation of wage differences, considering a wide range of factors and providing well-supported examples.
